title: Conditional Expectation
contentHtml: The conditional expectation E[Y|X] is a fundamental concept in probability theory that helps us understand how to predict the expected value of Y given the value of X.

theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the conditional expectation is a linear operator and applying the law of iterated expectations.

intuition: The conditional expectation helps us understand how to predict the expected value of Y given the value of X. It's like taking a snapshot of the distribution of Y at each possible value of X.
